hybridbn, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I take narcotics for pain and cymbalta for depression. I have had a time with hard, impossible to pass stools. Suppositories and saline enema's have been necessary frequently in addition to laxatives like mineral oil and milk of magnesia which take 2-3 days to work for me.  Never had any success at all with Colace until someone told me to take it with each of 3 meals.  Hooray, this works great!  The gas has been horrid but at least I'm not agonizing while on the toilet.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I saw a GI specialist because I have issues with my intestines. Not sure if it's IBS or some sort of malabsorption or intolerance to food. She recommended this to me suggesting that I should be having 2 bowel movements a day (at the weight I am) and that emptying my bowels in addition to the changes I was already making in my diet would provide me relief. She assured me it wouldn't make me have to go, it would just make the stools easier to pass and a little bigger in length. Well, she was wrong. I never had a problem with bowel movements. Never been constipated. However, not only did this medication give me worse gas and cramping than I've ever felt, it also gives me incomplete bowel movements. I never feel "finished" and it causes more gas and bloating. It's been more uncomfortable and embarassing than any of my other symptoms had previously which caused me to see a doctor in the first place. I have stopped taking this medication and am going back to just regulating my diet and trying to lose weight. I was going okay with that. Stay away from drugs unless it's a life-threatening issue. They cause more problems than anything else.

column2: webmedi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used this medication in liquid form one time while in the hospital.  It burned my throat and roof of my mouth.  I followed it with water and then with liquid Vicodin and some more water.  The Burning was severe and I was concerned that it would cause damage to my recent esophageal and stomach surgery the reason for my being in the hospital for almost two weeks. I followed The burning dose with water, couple of ice-creams and some pudding. It was a frightening experience. Be aware of this possible side effect.  I will use something less irritating to achieve the desired effect.

column9: I have been on Colace for 3 years because my meds caused infrequent bowel movements.  I take 2 capsules a day. column2: 19-24 Male  (Caregiver)
column9: Believe it or not, this medication has a secondary use.  I do not recommend using it personally without medical guidance, but I am a medic in the US Army, and we also use colace for ear impactions.  It softens the wax buildup and helps the impaction come out with ease.  I have used peroxide and the ear drops, but nothing I have used comes close to this medication.

My doctor told me to take 2 daily.  Nothing happened, so over a week I increased to taking actually 6 daily.  It's been 2 weeks now and still no movement :(  My stomach is extremely bloated as I'm sure you can imagine.  Going to go straight to laxitives tomorrow even though I know you aren't supposed to get dependant on those.
